H0.text: What is the name of the strong fibrous tissue that joins one bone to another at a joint. Tendon

H1.text: What is the name of the strong fibrous tissue that joins one bone to another at a joint. Cartilage

H2.text: What is the name of the strong fibrous tissue that joins one bone to another at a joint. Sinew

H3.text: What is the name of the strong fibrous tissue that joins one bone to another at a joint. Ligament

A4.text: Ligaments connect bones to other bones to form joints, while tendons connect bone to muscle.

A5.text: A ligament is a type of fibrous connective tissue in the body that connects bones to other bones.
